thread.title: Scenes of a Thundersnow Day in New York City
thread.title_full: Scenes of a Thundersnow Day in New York City

title: Scenes of a Thundersnow Day in New York City

organizations.name: gop oversight chair calls conway promoting ivanka
bodega rally was a testament to solidarity
ninth circuit judges unanimously rebuff trump

text:
Like that umbrella was going to last, buddy. Photo: Bryan R. Smith/AFP/Getty Images New York City is getting walloped by a February snowstorm. Check that: thundersnow storm.
We just had thunder snow at our office!
‚Äî NWS New York NY (@NWSNewYorkNY) February 9, 2017 Thundersnow! #nico #weather #blizzard @weatherchannel #nyc pic.twitter.com/TStIkFHzo7
‚Äî Chris Quintano (@chrisquintano) February 9, 2017 About eight to twelve inches of snow is expected in New York City. By 7 a.m., Central Park had recorded two inches of snow, though with flakes falling at a rate of one to three inches per hour , that number is likely shot. Early-morning totals were a bit higher in the Bronx (six inches), and Hollis, Queens, and Gravesend, Brooklyn, both logged in around four inches. La Guardia Airport hit nine inches by about 9 a.m.
Take a peek at the snow from Central Park ‚õÑ
Thanks to bhushan_nyc (IG) for sharing his ‚ùÑÔ∏èÔ∏èüì∑ with #abc7NY ! Let's see yours! pic.twitter.com/9dINfzLZ4Q
‚Äî Eyewitness News (@ABC7NY) February 9, 2017 Public schools are closed . The adult snow day is basically dead , but for those forced to commute to the office, the upside of 20-degree temperatures, bitterly cold winds, broken umbrellas, wet feet, and crappy visibility was a seat on the subway during rush hour.
#snow day Rush hour #NYC #subway #6train pic.twitter.com/fcPhqvlljk
‚Äî Naedine Hazell (@njoyhazell) February 9, 2017 Not too bright in Fulton St subway today ‚Äì the oculus is covered in snow. pic.twitter.com/fbEA6X8i4g
‚Äî Alastair Coote (@_alastair) February 9, 2017 And the snow brought out the requisite cross-country skiers:
Central Park West. Buses have chains, skiers have skis. pic.twitter.com/iPe5Ri5Y9K
‚Äî Kate Hinds (@katehinds) February 9, 2017 The heaviest snow will fall before 1 p.m., and then taper off until it‚Äôs pretty much clear by evening. The blizzardlike conditions are making for a quiet, beautiful, social-media-worthy city scene.
And Washington Square chess boards not being used for chess... #Snowzilla pic.twitter.com/xCXQu2W9N8
‚Äî Charlie Szymanski (@MrMetlHed) January 23, 2016 NEW: heavy snow piling up in Times Square, NYC creating a beautiful sight @breakingweather #nyc #snow #noreaster pic.twitter.com/x6AuaV60vT
‚Äî Reed Timmer (@ReedTimmerAccu) February 9, 2017 So much snow!!! ‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è‚ùÑÔ∏è #NYC
A video posted by Ashley Caum (@ashleycaum) on Feb 9, 2017 at 6:44am PST
The holiday lights left on the trees make it look somewhat charming out there. pic.twitter.com/Hm8UFgGGA0
‚Äî Liz Cho (@LizCho7) February 9, 2017 Montefiore Park when I was on my way to subway. #nyc #snowday2017 #snow #harlem
A photo posted by Lidia Blanco (@maverickudo) on Feb 9, 2017 at 7:29am PST
It's beautifully cold by my house. I'm staying indoors today. #canarsie #brooklyn #nyc #ny #snow #storm #fox5ny #bebuffwellness pic.twitter.com/Ks4TzZIZBr
‚Äî Be Buff Wellness (@BeBuffWellness) February 9, 2017 #NYC #snow
A photo posted by Jason Adams (@jasonaadams) on Feb 9, 2017 at 5:56am PST
Heavy #snow falling in #NYC this morning. Many flight cancellations to the NE US. 10"+ of snow likely. #nywx @WWLTV @CBSThisMorning pic.twitter.com/uMDXpHXvDD
‚Äî Dave Nussbaum WWL-TV (@Dave_Nussbaum) February 9, 2017 Morning scene. South Staten Island. #snow #nyc pic.twitter.com/6ocVeE321z
‚Äî Suzanne Bohn (@A_Sue_growsinBK) February 9, 2017 Yesterday was 60 degrees and now.... 6:30am #winter #snowfall #nyc #brooklyn #itstarts #slush
A video posted by Brianna Colette (@briannacoletteofficial) on Feb 9, 2017 at 3:58am PST
Which will turn into an icy, soppy hellscape in a matter of time.
#NYC now! #6th #Avenue #snow #weather pic.twitter.com/q8bB9dMseA
‚Äî D (@PhosOptics) February 9, 2017 slush fun #nyc #pennstation
A photo posted by brian healey (@misterhealey) on Feb 9, 2017 at 5:22am PST
Garbage-filled slush puddles coming soon.
Tags: snow day gallery talking about the weather Share on Facebook Tweet this Story Top Stories Richard Branson Helps Obama Cram 8 Years of Relaxation Into One Vacation NYC‚Äôs Bodega Rally Was a Testament to Solidarity and Patriotism 24 Hours at JFK: The Hour-by-Hour Account of Two Iraqis‚Äô Detainment and Release Most Viewed Stories Kellyanne Conway‚Äôs Endorsement of Ivanka Products Apparently Violates Federal Law Alec Baldwin Assures the Nation That His Upcoming SNL Episode Is Going to Be a ‚ÄòBig Deal‚Äô Republican Senator Admits GOP Health-Care Plan Has to Remain Secret Because It Will Be Unpopular Kellyanne Conway Says to ‚ÄòGo Buy Ivanka‚Äôs Stuff‚Äô A Brief History of ‚ÄòCash Me Outside, Howbow Dah?‚Äô Steve Bannon and Reince Priebus Want You to Know They Are Friends Watching Donald Trump Try to Puzzle Out What ‚ÄòAsset Forfeiture‚Äô Means Is Deeply Discomfiting 30 Years Later, RoboCop Is More Relevant Than Ever Eight Legendary Women, All of Whom Are Jessica Lange 100 More Jokes That Shaped Modern Comedy Most Popular Video On Daily Intelligencer Finally a Way to Protect Elephants from Humans Latest News from Daily Intelligencer 14 mins ago Ninth Circuit Judges Unanimously Rebuff Trump, Keep Travel Ban on Hold The ruling more or less took apart the government‚Äôs case for rushing the ban into effect.
6:39 p.m. Now That the Snowstorm‚Äôs Mostly Done, What‚Äôs the Damage? Largest snowfall of the year so far.
6:19 p.m. Tom Perez Scores an Own Goal in DNC Contest The candidate of the Clinton-Obama camp seemed to be agreeing with Sanders supporters that the 2016 primaries were ‚Äúrigged.‚Äù Bad idea.
5:59 p.m. GOP Oversight Chair Calls Conway Promoting Ivanka‚Äôs Brand ‚ÄòUnacceptable‚Äô But the president attacking private companies for dropping Ivanka‚Äôs brand is, apparently, totally fine.
4:13 p.m. Watchdog Hits Kellyanne Conway With Formal Ethics Complaint The complaint says she violated federal law with her comments about Ivanka Trump‚Äôs line.
3:59 p.m. Trump‚Äôs Tiny Thumbs Were a Big Fundraising Asset in Campaign A report from the RNC says GOP donors responded best to pictures of Trump giving a double thumbs-up.
2:20 p.m. In Call With Putin, Trump Trashes Nuclear Arms Treaty He‚Äôd Never Heard Of When Putin asked Trump about extending New START, the president asked his aides what that was ‚Äî then decried the treaty as a ‚Äúbad deal.‚Äù
1:56 p.m. U.S. Is Trying to Repair Relations With Mexico by Mostly Leaving Trump Out of It Secretary of State Tillerson met with his Mexican counterpart in Washington, and is headed to Mexico City in the coming weeks.
1:49 p.m. Editorial Says Gorsuch Questioning of Trump ‚ÄòDisheartening‚Äô In a plan B for Team Trump if they cannot deny Gorsuch is criticizing the boss, Sun editorial suggests the president has a mandate to ignore courts.
1:33 p.m. Report: No One Wants to Be Trump‚Äôs Communications Director Kellyanne Conway says plenty of people want the job, but the White House is ‚Äúdeciding what to do.‚Äù
12:28 p.m. The Mattis-Bannon Race for Secret President May Be Most Important of Our Lives Bannon says a war with China is inevitable. Mattis is telling our allies that we don‚Äôt need to take ‚Äúmilitary steps‚Äù against Beijing or Tehran.
12:02 p.m. Watching Trump Try to Puzzle Out What ‚ÄòAsset Forfeiture‚Äô Means Is Discomfiting Within about 60 seconds he goes from having no idea what something is, to developing strong feelings about it, to being outraged anyone disagrees.
11:17 a.m. Trump Sends Belated New Year‚Äôs Greetings to Chinese Leader After provoking China before and immediately after his election, the president is playing a poor game of diplomatic catch-up.
10:57 a.m. Scenes of a Thundersnow Day in New York City Schools are closed, the subways are empty, and the cross-country skiers are out as the city preps for up to a foot of snow.
10:25 a.m. ‚ÄòBig Luther‚Äô Strange Will Replace Jeff Sessions in the U.S. Senate The super-tall Alabama attorney general is seen as a good bet to retain the seat for the GOP in a 2018 special election.
10:14 a.m. Trump Suggests His Supreme Court Pick Is Fine With Attacks on the Judiciary Trump argues that Judge Gorsuch couldn‚Äôt have criticized him, because Richard Blumenthal didn‚Äôt really serve in Vietnam.
9:57 a.m. Kellyanne Conway‚Äôs Ivanka Product Endorsement Apparently Broke the Law A federal employee may not ‚Äúuse his public office ‚Ä¶ for the endorsement of any product, service or enterprise.‚Äù
9:09 a.m. Republican Senator: Health Plan Must Remain Secret Because It Will Be Unpopular Senator Mike Lee says the part he was supposed to think in his head.
8:50 a.m. Steve Bannon and Reince Priebus Want You to Know They‚Äôre Actually Friends The rumors they are in a Hunger Games‚Äì style death match? ‚ÄúIt bothers us because it‚Äôs not true. We actually like and care about each other a lot.‚Äù
6:54 a.m. Arizona Mother May Be Facing Deportation Owing to Trump Immigration Order Guadalupe Garc√≠a de Rayos, who left Mexico at 14, has been checking in with immigration agents for years. This time she was arrested.
